comments.commentBody:
With Trump's morning foray of unhinged Tweeting we witnessed more evidence of the latest 'which hunt' to plague the Trump Administration. 'Which' Trump can we now expect at any given moment?

'Prozac Trump' who spoke before Congress earlier in the week or the 'Unhinged Trump' up before dawn this morning accusing the Obama Administration of wire taps during the election? Or maybe the
'Clueless Trump' we saw aboard the USS Gerald Ford who said he was standing behind Jeff Sessions refusal to recuse himself from a hearing to investigate Russian interference in our recent presidential elections, even though Sessions had agreed to recuse himself from said hearings hours earlier. With this kid of disarray I believe we can anticipate 'Which Hunts' for months and months to come.

The man is not well.

Even if you posit that he is only pretending to be mentally ill, you then have to ask what type of judgment a person who routinely pretends to be off his rocker has.

Wednesday: President Trump addresses Congress - it's lyrical, conciliatory - presidential.
Saturday: A flurry of tweets: Obama went low to "tapp" Trump's phone; Sen. Schumer spoke to Putin and should be investigated; and Arnold Schwarzenegger was fired from Celebrity Apprentice (bad).
Remarkable, funny (or sick)?

More Trump being Trump.  Another accusation, another defamation to take the focus off his own incompetence and inappropriate (possibly illegal) behavior and actions.  He is an embarrassment to this country and to the GOP.  Flynn lied and got caught; Sessions lied and got caught; Spicer lies and gets away with it (for now);  Manafort lied and got caught; Trump lies on top of his lies.  He's unfit for office.  It's pretty simple.   Trump is the truly "bad (or sick) guy in this story.

........"a series of known steps taken by President Barack Obama's administration in its last months to undermine Donald Trump's presidential campaign, and, later, his new administration."

Come on, come on, what are they? What are these "known steps?" Come on, come up with the goods and get it out there. We all want to see the proof. Let's go.

You cant push this garbage on us forever, Breibart. It won't work. A lot of people who voted for Trump were not delusional, they just wanted jobs back. They're not going to believe outright lies and innuendo. They're not falling for this nonsense.

If the Justice Department, during the Obama administration, authorized any sort of surveillance, there was probable cause and a warrant issued. Believe it.

Trump understands a lawsuit right? That's where I'd go with this. He's calling President Obama a criminal, a sick guy. Well ok, he can give evidence in court under oath then. But then an oath means very little to him and his cabinet members.
I think Trump has to move toward an indictment. This is as serious as it gets.

J, I think you swung and missed on this one. Obama should sue for defamation of character. I dont get your indictment take and anyway, Presidents dont indict, that job belongs to the Justice Department and Attorney General.

Donald Trump's rants, in this case echoing the rants of Mark Levin should not become instant NYT headlines.  Serious media should immediately stop covering Trump's tweets as if they were news.  The front page of the Times should not be held hostage to Trump's nightly outbursts.
I sympathise, but unfortunately, it's news that the POTUS is saying certifiably loony stuff like this, especially if his own party is failing to react to it in any way at all.
I think Trump is about to be held accountable for this series of tweets.  Sorry, his tweets are news.  He's POTUS.
Lack of judgement yes.  Shocking? No.
This is Trump of birther fame, who charged Cruz's father of hobnobbing with Oswald, and ...., on and on it goes.  Trump has demonstrated that he'll say anything -- and lie.  Breitbart, really?
Ed Koch, the late mayor of NYC, supposedly once said, "I wouldn't believe anything Donald Trump said if his tongue was notarized."

How does he know that Obama did it? Maybe the Russians did, they're very sneaky and usually the reason for all the bad things in the world.

My car didn't start today and I'm pretty sure Putin had a hand in it.
Putin would NEVER get his hands dirty. He would bump off the mechanic he hired to do so to cover his tracks.

If there are any spine - there aren´t with a few exceptions - the G.O.P. members of Congress should step up and immediately demand proof from the president. This are very grave accusations. But everybody allready knows the answer - there are no substance what so ever - and the G.O.P. high-ranking officals are just fine with it: "Trump is just being Trump!" (right you are Mike Pence). May the filth brought on the nation by this party mark them for generations to come.

I am finding Trump's behaviors increasingly frightening and irrational.

The question is, how long will it take, and what will happen in the meantime, until someone (who? his family?) gets him to a psychiatrist and he is institutionalized. Not only does the emperor have no clothes, he is most likely crazy to boot.

He is probably beginning to realize that his so-far hidden agreements with Russia and his tax returns are going to surface, and he is desperate.

Trump is a very fragile & insecure man.....the danger is that when he is finally faced with what he perceives as failure,he may do something totally irrational( more than usual) or do something to himself.
He said it himself: He could kill a person in the middle of NY, and nothing would happen to him. Why? I'm as baffled as everyone else.
Let's suppose there was a warrant for surveillance on his phones or computers via a FISA request.  Wouldn't his actions now, upon learning on this, violate some law?

The most likely explanation is that Mr. Trump is frothing in reaction to a conspiratorial Breitbart article, based on nothing. This calls into question Mr. Trump's fitness for the job (again).

On the other hand, if he's posting Twitter tantrums based on briefings he's had at the White House, what is that nature of that information? Was it from a classified intelligence briefing? Wouldn't that be every bit as illegal as the leaks he's so worked up about? The difference of course, is that it would be publicly documented who leaked the classified information: the President.

Then, of course, there's the fact that if there were actual wiretaps, they would have been approved by a judge, with probable cause that those being wiretapped could be committing crimes or acting on behalf of foreign governments.

There really don't appear to be any scenarios where the information behind Mr. Trump's rant today leaves him as a maligned innocent person.

Are you folks unaware that your arguments are all based on the consistent use of words like "rant" "orange" and "buffoon" and sorely lacking in any substance other than innuendo?

Breitbart (oooh, I said a dirty word for the Legt, didn't I?) provides a clear rendition of the facts, but the Left has made sure that no one will consider the basis of his arguments behind Trump's allegations.SO much easier just to discount them out of hand.

You live in a nation with a free press, but what's the point if you close your minds to any information you won't want to hear? You might as well be living in the police state the masked men exerting violence against innocent speech attendees and marchers have in mind.

Dont' worry: it's not far off.
http://ijr.com/2017/03/817178-berkeley-riot-explodes-trump-supporters-be...

He's not "reacting". Trump called the cabal together. They came up with the counter attack which is always predictable with the rightwing.They accused President  Obama of doing what they are doing-using the power of government for revanchist purposes. Breitbart instructed his minions to put it out into the blogosphere. Fox will follow suit and the cable news groups will jump on the train. The Bush administration did it all the time to justify invading Iraq. Judith Miller, dressed in her trench coat and fedora would meet with Cheney's minion, Scooter Libby, and he would lie to her about weapons of mass destruction. She would write it up in the NYT. Cheney would go on TV and say, "look. Even the NYT is saying that Iraq has WMDs".

Was there ever any questions about Trump's fitness among those who think?  I don't think so.  The GOP is likely to turn on him and have Pence invoke the 25th Amendment.  Not that they'll be better, in fact, probably worse.
And, clicking steel balls nervously in his hand, he says he also knows who stole the strawberries from the officer's mess.
Except that Trump lacks the pathos of a Captain Queeg who served his country steadfastly in a Navy and military that had been neglected and all but forgotten by the time they were really needed.
Trump is such as liar. Put up the proof or shut up.

Trump "projects" a lot. Projection is a psychological defense mechanism in which a person places their own internal and personally unacceptable intents, feelings, attitudes ,fears and deeds out side of the self and onto someone else where it feels much safer. "We always hate in others what we secretly hate in ourselves." If you really want to know what Trump has personally done, consider his projections onto others. Projection is a primitive and rather immature trait or pattern. It's most frequently seen in adolescents and is usually outgrown in early adulthood, although individuals with certain personality disorders tend to hand onto "projections"  long into adulthood.
What if projection coincides with paranoia?  Where can that take a person?
Distraction, distraction, don't take your eyes off the ball, NYT, you're doing great.

Every time you think the president has hit the bottom, he finds a way to go lower.  Has any American president ever made such disgraceful comments publicly about another president?  I can't imagine what must the rest of the world must think of his unrestrained recklessness.  If his uses words this way, will he eventually find a way to use the power of the presidency, specifically the nuclear arsenal, to act in a similarly reckless way?  Truly, this man is unfit to hold the office of the most powerful person on earth.

I consider myself to possess an above-average imagination, and I am no stranger to the creative process ... but I cannot quite wrap my mind around the fact that the President of the United States is tweeting lunatic nonsense to 25M 'followers' at 4 in the morning. If he were just some doddering old fool uncle, this tinfoil-hat nonsense would get him a "welfare check" from the local police.

If anything calls out for the 25th Amendment, this is it.

Obama also at first denied his administration bugged the phone of our European allies.

Obama lied then, to our allies, to the world, but you believe him now?
As a kid around seven I was under the covers listening to rock 'n roll with an earphone through my cheap red Japanese transistor radio at about 4AM. Sound familiar, as far as age mentality I mean?

There were safeguards put into place since Obama was caught in that lie. If they have been circumvented Trump needs to come out with more than a Breitbart conspiracy theory, and Breitbart needs to be called in for sources just as many others have been challenged from RESPECTABLE news agencies.

This is simple.

Progressives should join hands with Trumpistas and demand that an independent prosecutor be set up to determine whether President Obama ordered the tapping of Trump's phones.

Let's get to the bottom of this!
There was a FISA court order permitting this. Someone in the Obama approved that. Are you saying Obama wasn't in charge of his admin? Ok, then if he wasn't, WHO WAS?
I totally agree; it's similar to the absurd (but certainly lapped up) multi-millions voter fraud claim; ummm, yessss, indeed, let's get to the bottom of that by all means...lord.

I am truly astonished by your lack of imagination, California. You're responding from your own blinkered imagination in the form of:

This is just another outrageous lie or misdirected slander being pedaled by Trump.

And, yes, it is that.

But it is much more!

Trump has just leaped into what I'll call an Oscar Wilde moment, especially with the story I now see as the lead story in the NYT, which is an update of this story, that Trump has come out and vociferously called for an investigation.

For the details of the Oscar Wilde Moment, if you are not aware of them, go here and read also the following section on Regina v. Wilde:

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oscar_Wilde#Wilde_v._Queensberry

Once an investigation of this sort gets underway, there is very little question that it will end up drawing Russiagate into its web, one way or another.

This is simply a version of "Be careful what you ask for."

The risk to Obama is basically zilch.

The downside risk to Trump is gigunda!

Just broaden your forensic imagination a bit, California.

Or having seen some of your other comments, maybe deep down you really are in fear that this is the boomerang Trump has just lofted?

Trump has the emotional intelligence and temperament of a child.

Embarrassed by the spectacle his so-called fine tuned presidency is turning out to be, he just reacts like a child does for any mishap: Tommy (or in this case, Barry) did it.

He did that with Flynn speaking to Pence. He did it with Sessions ("could have been more accurate on Russia response"). He did it with the flawed planning of the Yemen raid (the generals were to blame). He does it with blaming Schumer for obstructing filling the vacancies in government when he doesn't even have the names. He did it with Spicer's press conference when the guy was obviously quoting Trump on inauguration crowds. Now, he's blaming Obama, when it's about actions by bad hombres in his administration.

Forget about a terrible agenda. It's the bad management that is the real disaster which is how history will remember the Trump presidency. After taking mouthfuls of water, Trump says: Who knew that Healthcare (read: Presidency) could be so complicated?...

I have come to the conclusion, despite giving Trump the benefit of the doubt, that he is mentally ill and must be removed from office or reined in in some manageable way so he cannot further damage our country.  Reckless statements and accusations from Trump such as these, unfounded and without any supporting evidence, are a cancer on our democracy and way of life.  What happens if Trump wakes up one morning and decides it's time to get even with China?  WWIII?

Reckless? Nope. The record shows the Obama Admin went twice to the FISA for permission to tap. Once was denied and once was approved. The fact is there.

Or are you denying Obama went to the FISA court even though there is record of it?

More here:
https://californiajimmy.com/2017/03/04/trump-accuses-obama-wire-tapping-...
Maybe Trump knew all along and cooperated with the feds.
